summary: Gertrude Weaver  was an American supercentenarian.
full_text: Sarah DeRemer Knauss  was an American supercentenarian. She was considered the world's oldest living person by Guinness World Records from April 16, 1998, the date of the death of 117-year-old Canadian Marie-Louise Meilleur, until her own death. Knauss is the second-oldest fully documented person ever, behind Jeanne Calment. She was the last verified living person to have been born before 1885.
title: Sarah Knauss
